intro: Leontodon glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth leontodon, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowering stems are usually unbranched. Leontodon glabrescens is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of certain grassland ecosystems.
